com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.appendable

Class AppendablePrintLineWithPrefix

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.appendable.AbstractSimplifiedAppendable
      • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.appendable.AppendablePrintLineWithPrefix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Appendable

    @NotFullyTested
public class AppendablePrintLineWithPrefix
extends AbstractSimplifiedAppendable
    This is a class is offered as a sample implementation of AbstractSimplifiedAppendable, which implements Appendable. It may be used as a character-based callback in ProcessBuilder2 via AbstractProcessSettings.stdoutSettings(), then ProcessOutputStreamSettings.charCallback(Appendable).

    Instances of this class are constructed with a PrintStream, such as System.out, and a prefix, such as "STDOUT: ". When append(CharSequence) is called, the prefix, then the text, is printed via PrintStream.println(String).

    Author:
    Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)

      AppendablePrintLineWithPrefix(PrintStream stream, String prefix) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Appendable append(CharSequence csq)
      Incoming text has a prefix added, then passed to PrintStream.println(String).

    • Constructor Detail

      • AppendablePrintLineWithPrefix

        public AppendablePrintLineWithPrefix(PrintStream stream,
                             String prefix)
        Parameters:
        stream -
        • PrintStream to write via PrintStream.println(String)
        • Must not be null
        • Example: System.out or System.err
        prefix -
        • Prepended to each CharSequence received by append(CharSequence)
        • Must not be null, but can be empty
        • Example: "STDOUT: " or "STDERR: "

                  throws IOException
        Incoming text has a prefix added, then passed to PrintStream.println(String).

        Throws:
        IOException
